Component.title: Component
Component.description: Represents a hardware component, such as CPU, GPU, RAM, etc.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Component entity.

name.description: The name of the component (e.g., Intel Core i9-13900K, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090).

type.description: The type of component (e.g., CPU, GPU, RAM, Motherboard, Storage, etc.).

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the component (e.g., Intel, NVIDIA, Corsair).

model.description: The model number or identifier for the component.

specifications.description: Detailed technical specifications of the component in JSON format.

performanceScore.description: A performance benchmark score for the component.

imageUrl.description: URL to an image of the component.

Peripheral.title: Peripheral
Peripheral.description: Represents a peripheral device, such as a monitor, keyboard, mouse, etc.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Peripheral entity.

name.description: The name of the peripheral (e.g., Dell UltraSharp U2720Q, Logitech G Pro X Superlight).

type.description: The type of peripheral (e.g., Monitor, Keyboard, Mouse, Headset).

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of the peripheral (e.g., Dell, Logitech).

model.description: The model number or identifier for the peripheral.

specifications.description: Detailed technical specifications of the peripheral.

imageUrl.description: URL to an image of the peripheral.

UserConfiguration.title: UserConfiguration
UserConfiguration.description: Represents a user's saved or simulated desktop configuration, which can be a full build or an upgrade analysis.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserConfiguration entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns this configuration.

name.description: A descriptive name for the configuration (e.g., 'My Dream Gaming PC', 'Upgrade Analysis 2024-05-15').

description.description: A more detailed, user-provided description of the configuration.

aiResponse.description: The full, original Markdown response generated by the AI.

details.description: A flexible field to store structured data about the configuration, depending on its type.

totalCost.description: Total cost of a new build.

performanceScore.description: Performance score for a new build.

currentValue.description: Estimated value of the user's current hardware before an upgrade.

componentIds.description: References to Components used in the configuration.

peripheralIds.description: References to Peripherals used in the configuration.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the configuration was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the configuration was last updated.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was last updated.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, support required QAPs (Queries are not Filters), and maintain data integrity.

*   **Authorization Independence:** UserConfiguration documents are stored under the `/users/{userId}/configurations/{configId}` path. This structure inherently provides authorization independence as access control is based on the path itself and the `userId`. There is no need to fetch parent document to check for authorization.
*   **QAPs Support:** The chosen structure enables secure list operations. Listing configurations is scoped to the user's own configurations using the path `/users/{userId}/configurations`. Therefore, rules can be written to allow listing configurations only for the authenticated user without additional filtering.
*   **Structural Segregation:** Different data types (components, peripherals, user configurations, and users) are stored in separate collections according to their distinct security needs. This simplifies security rule definitions by ensuring homogeneity within each collection.
*   **Access Modeling:** We prioritize path-based ownership for private data like UserConfigurations (`/users/{userId}/configurations/{configId}`).

This design directly addresses the core design principles and strategy mandates, resulting in a secure, scalable, and debuggable Firestore structure.
